title: SIT Files
content:
Yeah, I have some “SIT” font archive files that were made on a Mac. I use Win. Wuz wondering if someone would be kind enough to open them up on their Mac and then convert them to Win???

 [‹ Bickham Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014603/http:/typophile.com/node/18124 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font management ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014603/http:/typophile.com/node/18101 "Go to next forum topic")
author: loavesandfishes

comments.content:
L&F, you can download the trial version of Stuffit for Windows, which will allow you to unstuff your files:  
 [http://www.stuffit.com/win/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080519014603/http:/www.stuffit.com/win/index.html "http://www.stuffit.com/win/index.html")

Keep in mind, if the fonts are standard Mac TrueType or Postscript, they will not work with Windows. In addition the fonts will likely have their resource forks removed if they are on a Windows box. I mention this, because if they were OpenType or TrueType, they wouldn’t have needed to be stuffed in the first place.
